Text: Thank you to An-Nisa Hope Center and @MinaretTweets for welcoming me and our #TX07 Team and sharing your insights from your work in southwest Houston about how empowering and protecting individuals, especially recent immigrants, empowers our community. #TX07 https://t.co/QiV4tqhDzH

A year ago, many in #TX07 woke up without electricity‚Äîor soon lost it, beginning a week with tragic consequences at home and across Texas. 

Since then, Congress has held hearings to learn more about what went wrong and passed #AmericaCOMPETES Act to invest in grid resilience.

In the four years since the Parkland shooting‚Äîafter which students demanded action from lawmakers across the country‚Äîthe House has passed overwhelmingly popular bills like H.R. 8 to require background checks.

We do this in their memory. ‚¨áÔ∏è The Senate must, as well. https://t.co/u4yhlMLcRb

113 years ago, Black leaders called for a conference on the "renewal of the struggle for civil and political liberty." And when they met, they formed the @NAACP.

Today, we celebrate their legacy and continued work to ensure equality and dignity for all. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/zBOxkqokRx

On this day in 1809, President Abraham Lincoln was born in a log cabin to parents of humble means. In his remarkable life, he profoundly shaped our Union.

"With malice toward none with charity for all," he helped make it a more perfect union. Today, we must continue that work. https://t.co/CDUGCXzk7z

Today, I voted for the the bipartisan #PostalServiceReformAct to get the USPS on the financial footing it needs to provide the high-quality service Houstonians deserve. https://t.co/p9H1XvzWUJ

This #BlackHistoryMonth, we celebrate #TX07 neighbor Mae Jemison, a physician and a true pioneer who in 1992 became the first woman of color in space.

Her mission continues as she advocates for women and minorities in STEM, including to the @HouseScience Committee! https://t.co/SSlbIIurDb

With bold steps in health R&D like those taken 100 years ago, when the first insulin shot was administered, U.S. has long been at the forefront of medicine.

Let's do everything we can to make the next wave easier. Get vaccinated & boosted.

https://t.co/uwy53P8Uef

The United States needs to improve supply chain resilience so we can manufacture critical goods, industrial equipment, and technology right here at home.

I voted for #AmericaCOMPETES to strengthen our economy and our national security. https://t.co/8Qwy0mMC0y

Home COVID-19 tests should be widely available & free.

I've been working with my colleagues to expand access‚Äîfrom those available at https://t.co/VPgHFZNmfA to requiring insurance to cover additional kits.

Unreliable grids and cyberattacks have left Texans and people across the country out in the cold.

I worked to authorize $375 million for the development, testing, and monitoring of critical electric grid equipment in the #AmericaCOMPETES Act, and fought for its passage. https://t.co/tlaynb9dqG

Texans are seeing the real impact of supply chain issues. That includes products that use semiconductor chips, like our cars and our phones. 

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act addresses supply chain issues and ensures that semiconductor chips are developed here in the United States. https://t.co/XRgVL5VAXh

In language simple and clear, the Fifteenth Amendment, ratified on this day in 1870, affirmed the right to vote‚Äîregardless of race.

It also charged Congress with protecting this right. We must ensure the #FreedomToVote as we see barriers to voting being built across the country. https://t.co/MWQ1oKob0i

Medicaid has been a critical lifeline for people across Texas during the pandemic.

In Congress, I fought to make Medicaid expansion a reality for states like ours‚Äîand I will continue to do so until Texas expands Medicaid for the millions who live in the coverage gap. https://t.co/oE2No0JyGQ

We must reduce harmful global greenhouse gas emissions in order to combat climate change.

My bill, the #CLEARAct, will identify and invest in promising tech to reduce refinery emissions‚Äîhelping to get these projects off the ground to make a real impact.
üîóhttps://t.co/rlTpCcHr8K https://t.co/iaJ9aff4Nk

With temperatures dropping below freezing tonight, be sure to bring your pets inside!

Not only is it the compassionate thing to do for our furry friends‚Äîin Texas, it's the law. https://t.co/u6Gt4tdhFE

Since the Columbine school shooting, more than 292,000 students have been affected by gun violence at their schools.

That‚Äôs more than 292,000 survivors.

The Senate must pass the Bipartisan Background Checks Act, vote to close the Charleston loophole, & help us #EndGunViolence. https://t.co/Ecv0tBvT7s

We are so proud of the work that researchers in Houston have done to develop an accessible vaccine that can be used around the world in the fight against COVID-19.

Price gouging happens when people are at their most vulnerable. Whether during a pandemic, or a freeze, or other events, Texans have been victims of this practice.

Tonight, I was proud cast my vote for a bill I co-sponsored to name a post office for Rep. John Lewis in his beloved Atlanta.

May the naming of this civic institution remind all those who visit of the contributions that citizens can make, and of his faith in us to do so. #HR5577 https://t.co/Q1EYM1MLpP

Two years ago today, Virginia‚Äîthe final state needed‚Äîratified the Equal Rights Amendment. Texas, the home of great women leaders‚Äîfrom Barbara Jordan & Ann Richards to Beyonce & Simone Biles, ratified it 40 years ago.

Too many families are unable to access online learning or health care because of the high cost of internet service.

Today, those rights are under threat. That is why I am an original co-sponsor of the Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act #WHPA to codify Roe v. Wade. We have passed it in the House. It is time for the Senate to do so.

Today, I tested positive for a breakthrough case of COVID-19. I have been testing regularly, and am fully vaccinated and boosted. I‚Äôm grateful to only have mild symptoms and am quarantining and following CDC guidance.

Proud that the House met this challenge this week and passed the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act, which I proudly voted for.

My prayers are with the congregants for a peaceful resolution and thoughts will continue to be with them as the community there recovers.

If you are looking for some inspiration this weekend, watch the @HoustonMarathon. The diversity & determination of the runners and the support of those along the route in #TX07 & across the city is awesome.

Good luck to all those running the marathon, half, & 5K Sunday!

When Congress made this aid available, it was to help people directly impacted. More than 50% of those people are in Houston.

Last year, I sent a letter requesting the administration ensure funding goes where it is meant to. This shows it's working. https://t.co/q7XoeClD5M

Cy-Fair ISD students are an important part of our #TX07 community. I am deeply dismayed to hear a new Board member denigrate Black teachers and HISD.

These unacceptable statements do not reflect the values or ideals of our community or our dedicated teachers. https://t.co/4aNUXwgtpX
If you‚Äôve been waiting for a good time to get tested, there‚Äôs no line out at 6010 Richmond Avenue in #TX07! https://t.co/UOrLwAPyLG

H.R. 5746, the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act is vital to meeting our responsibility to protect voters and their access to the ballot box and to full participation in our democratic system.

I hope that the Senate will pass it without delay.

We must ensure that all eligible American voters have the ability to cast their votes safely, securely, and without obstruction.  

In Texas and across our country, we have seen an increasing assault on the ability to exercise this right and responsibility of citizenship.

üßµ: Proud to #FightForVotingRights by voting for the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act today.

Voting is the very foundation of our democracy. The right of citizens to cast their ballots for whomever they choose is not and should not be a partisan issue. https://t.co/82T3sbUIfR

National Guard and Reserve Members serve our communities in our times of greatest need. I was glad to vote today to ensure that they have the same access to the G.I. Bill benefits.

Today, my Gallery Group colleagues and I were honored to serve lunch to @CapitolPolice & Capitol staff.

Grateful to @ChefJoseAndres and World Central Kitchen for providing meals for those whose service to our country on January 6, 2021, and every day since, cannot be overstated. https://t.co/9U36PZt2Cj

Today, I joined several of my colleagues, many of whom were with me in the House Gallery that day, to observe this solemn anniversary and to share our experiences and reflections one year later. https://t.co/YAQHikLzBm

As we mark the one-year anniversary, it is important to remember that the attack on the Capitol and the Congress‚Äîthe representatives of the people‚Äîwas an attack on all of us, and on our democracy itself.

I'm grateful to the law enforcement officers who saved our lives and defended our democracy. 

We owe it to them, and to the American people, to find the facts and follow them where they lead‚Äîto do all we can to make sure it can never happen again.
Moments from the January 6 Capitol attack that are etched in my memory. https://t.co/0Tgqlthyv5
With positivity rates at an all-time high in our community, it's important to make tests and treatments available to Texans‚Äîand in Washington, we are doing just that. https://t.co/kjJWPLryHI

For years, Americans have been sent financially devastating surprise medical bills after unknowingly receiving care from out-of-network providers.

That ends now. The No Surprises Act went into effect Jan 1 to protect patients from this practice. #NoSurpriseBills https://t.co/wyegDFxUbt
